actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide for the nonrecognition of gain on sales and exchanges of capital assets when the proceeds are reinvested in certain minority investment funds.

summary.text: Minority Investment Tax Act of 1985 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide for the nonrecognition of capital gain where such gain is reinvested in the stock of a mutual fund or other investment company which: (1) primarily invests in business enterprises controlled by minority persons; and (2) is owned, managed, affiliated, or otherwise controlled by a qualified minority company.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide for the nonrecognition of gain on sales and exchanges of capital assets when the proceeds are reinvested in certain minority investment funds.
